page.title: 10A HILL FARM
page.content: The most common sheep breeds in the area are Swaledale and Rough Fell. Cattle are usually Friesian for milk. There are far more fields used for sheep than for cattle. The sheep meadows are cut for hay for winter feed at hay-time - June/July. The fells are used to grow bracken (one farm is called Brackensghyll) and for rough grazing. The land is never likely to be used for arable farming. The fields have to be fertilised quite heavily with slurry from the animal sheds. There are a lot of trees and quite a lot of planting has been done which does not show on the map. The fell top is still common land and the farms on the edge have grazing rights. The animals are brought down for shelter in the winter from October to April.
